div.a: Google Has Planted A Secret Surprise In Its High-End Chromebook

div.div: An "Easter egg" is a hidden message or joke that software developers sneak into their projects. Google has hidden one in its new, high-end Chromebook laptop, the Pixel.

div.a: 6 Non-Actors Who Won Oscars For Their Acting

div.a: The Rise Of New Shanghai

div.div: Throughout the metropolis, at the bases of the most sophisticated corporate office towers, modular dorm trailers, hung with laundry, house migrant workers, the new class of coolies building contemporary Shanghai.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XJ2wpL&via=Digg&text=The Rise Of New Shanghai

div.div: WE KNEW FLOSS WAS A SCAM

div.a: Ancient Chompers Were Healthier Than Ours

div.div: Prehistoric humans didn't have toothbrushes. They didn't have floss or toothpaste, and they certainly didn't have Listerine. Yet somehow, their mouths were a lot healthier than ours are today.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZrQ0xS&via=Digg&text=Ancient Chompers Were Healthier Than Ours

div.a: The Lost Tribes Of The Amazon

div.div: Often described as “uncontacted,” isolated groups living deep in the South American forest resist the ways of the modern world—at least for now.

div.a: Why Is The UFC So Stupid About Women?

div.div: Watching Rousey or any other female mixed martial artist raises an uncomfortable reality for the men who line the UFC's pockets—namely that women can be amazing athletes who are fully capable of sticking your dick in the dirt at a moment's notice.

div.a: The 8 Incredibly Gross Powers Superman Doesn’t Even Realize He Has

div.div: Everything about Superman is super, including all his bodily secretions and his bodily functions. In fact, they're probably not just super, like his eyes' ability to see through things; they probably give him specific powers, too... like the fact his X-ray eyes also provides heat vision.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YrqmGx&via=Digg&text=The 8 Incredibly Gross Powers Superman Doesn’t Even Realize He Has

div.div: There was only one thing to do with video of a bunch of linemen running a 40. So of course we set it to the best soundtrack.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VZ4hVK&via=Digg&text=Watch Linemen Run the 40 Yard Dash Set To Chariots Of Fire

div.a: Knocking On The Door Of The Jehovah’s Witnesses

div.div: "Do you want to die?" the man asks me. He stands on the steps leading to my front porch with a stack of literature in his arms.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/15DQd5p&via=Digg&text=Knocking On The Door Of The Jehovah’s Witnesses

div.a: The Shocking Savagery Of America's Early History

div.div: It’s all a bit of a blur, isn’t it? That little-remembered century—1600 to 1700. The century that saw all the disease-ridden, barely civilized successors to Jamestown slaughtering and getting slaughtered by the Original Inhabitants, hanging on by their fingernails to some fetid coastal swampland until Pocahontas saved Thanksgiving. No, that’s not right, is it? I said it was a blur.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YIQ5fO&via=Digg&text=The Shocking Savagery Of America's Early History

div.a: How A Photon Could Protect America From The World's Most Sophisticated Bad Guys

div.div: The Los Alamos National Laboratory quietly reported successfully completing "the first-ever demonstration of securing control data for electric grids using quantum cryptography."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W8Xo3W&via=Digg&text=How A Photon Could Protect America From The World's Most Sophisticated Bad Guys
